intro: Hieracium nizhnetunguskaense, commonly known as the Nizhnetunguska hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Russia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, rocky or sandy habitats, often in alpine or tundra environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium nizhnetunguskaense is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
